pageContext.claim: “We’re already down 63 percent of crossings, which is at a record. There’s never been a record like that. I’m sorry, 73 percent as of this morning, 73. It was actually reported last week at 73.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump is referring to the decline in apprehensions along the Southwest border, from December 2016 through April 2017. Indeed, apprehensions have declined dramatically, despite seasonal trends. While the decline can be attributed in part to his anti-illegal immigration rhetoric on the campaign trail, the numbers are less impressive when you compare them to the first full month under the Trump presidency. From February 2017 through April 2017, apprehensions declined by 41 percent.
